column4: hi guys. i ran ubuntu, and moved the system partition on the disk (booted from live cd to do that). Now i get a error 17 when grub loads. how can i tell grub that the partition has moved?
you need to reinstall the MBR component of grub, try the "grub-install" script
ok.. so where is that script? can i run it from live cd?
I think so, you should read the manpage first though, the script might be volatile...
ok cool.. so i'll just man grub it then i guess...
actually, reading the manpage myself, I think it may not exactly do what I want it to... did you ever do a manual grub install?
no i just installed ubuntu on a partition, and it fixed the grub part by itself
but now the ubuntu partition has been moved by me. so grub cant find it and boot it
hmm... can you get up to the grub menu?
no menu. it just says grub loading stage1.5    grub loading please wait... error 17
error 17 is it cant find the partition, which is correct
I feared so... this is a bitch to fix...
hmm but cant i just edit some file?
where is the grub.. stuff located?
no its a matter of rewriting grub to the MBR, the last time I tried that I got it wrong, my grub is rusty...
grub actually have 3 components: stage 1 on the MBR, stage 1,5 and stage 2 in /boot
well ok if it's that much trouble... i guess i'll just reinstall everything then.. i have the moste improtant stuff backed up anyway
it just not something I feel capable of helping with over IRC, its a couple of grub commands, but it has to be the right ones...
